channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Claudia Lawrence: Mum in 'utter shock' at new search
item.description: Joan Lawrence says "every single day is a nightmare" since her daughter disappeared in 2009.

item.title: Covid cases in south-west England highest among young people
item.description: Public Health England says among 15-24 year olds there are 1,700 cases per 100,000 people.

item.title: Ingoldmells caravan fire: Inquiry continues into girl's death
item.description: A two-year-old girl's death in the blaze at Ingoldmells is being treated as unexplained, police say.

item.title: Extinction Rebellion: Protesters block London's Oxford Circus
item.description: Campaigners have glued themselves to a giant table and formed a human chain around Oxford Circus.

item.title: Hertfordshire policeman cleared over 'smash your face in' threat
item.description: The police watchdog says there is no case to answer after a teenager was pinned to the ground.

item.title: A64: Two children and woman die in motorhome and lorry crash
item.description: All three were passengers in a motorhome when the crash happened on the A64 near York, police say.

item.title: Is this England's most unwanted dog?
item.description: Lurcher Sue has been overlooked while almost 950 dogs at her shelter have found new homes.

item.title: Pork scratchings recalled amid salmonella outbreak
item.description: At least 12 people receive hospital treatment as snacks including Mr Porky scratchings are recalled.

item.title: Gatwick Airport presses ahead with second runway plans
item.description: The airport revives plans to use its emergency runway for routine flights despite a fall in demand.

item.title: Police warning after dad called 101 to say girl stuck in coat
item.description: A senior officer urges people to "think before they call" after the report to West Midlands Police.

item.title: 'One million bees' killed in Nottinghamshire hives arson attack
item.description: Beekeeper Mariusz Chudy says he's "devastated" six of his beehives have been destroyed.

item.title: Kitten found on CrossCountry train in Birmingham
item.description: The male kitten is in good health and being cared for at a vets clinic in the West Midlands.

item.title: Blackpool man has Lake District tattoo so he 'can always see the fells'
item.description: A man from Blackpool has had the outline of a view of the Lake District fells tattooed on his arm.

item.title: DJ to hold Ministry of Sound fundraiser for twin brother in Covid coma
item.description: The twin of a DJ who fell into a coma after catching Covid is holding a club night to raise money for his care.

item.title: Hybrid electric plane takes first flight in England
item.description: Electric planes are "the future" and could revive local airports, industry experts suggest.

item.title: 'Marmite' Snake Pass road marks 200 years
item.description: While many enjoy its picturesque surroundings, in bad weather the route can see motorists stranded.

item.title: Mission: Impossible train crashes into quarry in Stoney Middleton
item.description: Local photographers said the film's star Tom Cruise had been at the quarry to witness the crash.

item.title: Church of England 'regret' over suicide of falsely accused priest
item.description: The Church admits "unreasonable pressures" were put on Fr Alan Griffin before he killed himself.

item.title: Festival return will be emotional, says boss
item.description: More than 100,000 revellers are expected to attend the attend the event in Reading.

item.title: Quorn Hunt members cleared of breaching fox-hunting ban
item.description: Prosecutors said after reviewing evidence from a witness there was no prospect of a conviction.

item.title: Simon Dobbin: Cambridge Utd fan's death linked to Southend attack
item.description: Simon Dobbin was brain damaged after being attacked following a match and died five years later.

item.title: The Smithy Family: Police release image of car in arson inquiry
item.description: The Smithy Family's London home caught fire after their car was set alight.

item.title: Cygnet Appletree: Mental health hospital 'did not protect patients'
item.description: The care watchdog took "urgent action" after finding a "toxic" culture at Cygnet Appletree.

item.title: Just Eat announces 1,500 new jobs in North East
item.description: The food delivery platform will invest Â£100m to create 1,500 new customer service roles.

item.title: Owner's devastation after four horses die in crash
item.description: Top eventer Nick Gauntlett's horse and three others died when a broken down horse transporter was struck by lorry near Perth.

item.title: Rare Jane Austen sketch loaned to Bath
item.description: The sketch by her sister is the only widely accepted portrait of the writer who lived in Bath.

item.title: Harry Kane: Tottenham striker says he will stay at the club
item.description: England captain Harry Kane says he will be "staying at Tottenham this summer" and is "100% focused on helping the team achieve success".

item.title: Fifa writes to PM Boris Johnson over release of players to red-list countries
item.description: Fifa president Gianni Infantino asks UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson for exemptions so Premier League clubs will release players for World Cup qualifiers in red-list countries.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sarah Storey wins 15th Paralympic gold as GB claim six medals
item.description: Britain's Sarah Storey wins her 15th Paralympic title for Britain's first gold medal at the Tokyo Games.

item.title: US Open qualifying: Emma Raducanu breezes into second round
item.description: Great Britain's Emma Raducanu breezes through to the second round of qualifying for the US Open.
